snippet: Such investments offer private equity firms a potential steady stream of income, while also helping struggling local governments.
abstract: DealBook Online; Kohlberg Kravis Roberts says it has raised $3.1 billion for new fund focused on investing in infrastructure.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: Such investments offer private equity firms a potential steady stream of income, while also helping struggling local governments.

headline.main: K.K.R. Raises $3.1 Billion to Invest in Road and Other Infrastructure Projects
